This art installation mimics cosmic radiator patterns.
A leaking car radiator can cause engine failure.

examples.sentence: The punk rocker dyed her hair green like a political radical from the 1960s.
Some tech radicals believe AI will replace all human jobs by 2045.
'Bio' is the radical in 'biology' meaning life.
Chinese characters with the å¥³(nÇš) radical often relate to females.
The math teacher drew a giant radical symbol on the blackboard.
Simplifying radicals is like untangling earphone wires.
His radical proposal to replace all exams with video games shocked the faculty.
The brand made a radical shift from suits to streetwear.
Blockchain requires a radical change in how we think about trust.
There's a radical difference between reading and actually experiencing VR.
Blueberries fight free radicals like mini superheroes.
Her radical chic style mixes protest slogans with designer bags.

examples.sentence: The punk movement in the 1970s was steeped in radicalism and anti-establishment ideals.
Some argue that radicalism in politics is like performing surgery with a chainsaw.
The coffee shop became a hub for discussions about political radicalism.
Some video games were accused of radicalizing players with extreme ideologies.
The cult leader radicalized his followers by cutting off their access to normal media.
The protest movement gradually became radicalized after police crackdown.

examples.sentence: TikTok has radically changed how Gen Z consumes content.
The new policy will radically reform China's education system.
After moving to Chengdu, her spice tolerance became radically different.
The smartphone market today is radically competitive.
Bubble tea tastes radically different with 50% sugar.
Marconi's radio revolutionized ocean communication.
The spy novel featured a radio hidden in a teapot.
Grandpa still listens to Peking opera on his vintage radio.
The earthquake survivor was located by the faint sound of a radio.
BBC World Service is my favorite English learning radio.
The pirate radio was shut down for playing uncensored songs.
The ship radioed for help when the typhoon approached.
Astronauts radioed breathtaking images back to Earth.
I heard your shout-out on the radio while stuck in traffic.
The reporter radioed in the latest updates from the protest site.
The glowing green liquid in cartoons is always radioactive material.
Marie Curie's notebooks are still radioactive after 100 years.
Bananas contain naturally radioactive potassium.
The geiger counter beeped wildly near the radioactive rocks.
Carbon-14 undergoes radioactive decay at a predictable rate.
The material glows radioactively in the dark like a ghostly firefly.
Japan plans to discharge treated water radioactively into the Pacific Ocean.
The Geiger counter clicked wildly near the radioactivity source.
Banana's natural radioactivity is lower than airport security scanners.
The dinosaur bone was dated using radiocarbon techniques.
Radiocarbon levels in this mummy's hair reveal her diet.
Scientists measure radiocarbon decay to determine artifact ages.
This panda fossil contains trace amounts of radiocarbon.
Modern radiography can detect cracks smaller than a hair width.
Airport security uses radiography to scan luggage without opening it.
Industrial radiography helps inspect welding quality in bridges.
The museum employed radiography to study the mummy's bandage layers.
Dentists now prefer digital radiography for its instant results.
Medical radiography technicians wear lead aprons for protection.
The radiologist spotted a tumor the size of a lychee in the X-ray.
As a radiologist, she can read CT scans like comic books.
The radiological protection suit makes doctors look like astronauts.
Radiological examinations require patients to hold still like statues.
AI-assisted radiological diagnosis is revolutionizing hospitals.
The museum's radiology exhibit explains how microwaves heat food.
Space radiology helps us understand cosmic background radiation.
Modern radiology allows doctors to see broken bones in 3D.
The CT scanner is the Ferrari of radiology equipment.
Diagnostic radiology revealed a tiny tumor smaller than a rice grain.
The interventional radiology team fixed my artery using X-ray guidance.
The radiometric purity of lab equipment determines nuclear experiment accuracy.
This radiometric camera can detect invisible gamma rays.
Carbon-14 dating relies on precise radiometric techniques.
Geologists use radiometric data to predict volcanic activity.
Technetium-99m is the most widely used radionuclide in medical imaging.
The Fukushima accident released dangerous radionuclides like cesium-137.
The panda at Beijing Zoo received radiotherapy for its tumor.
Modern radiotherapy can precisely target cancer cells like a cosmic GPS.
After eating 99 hotpot meals, his stomach had to undergo radiotherapy.
The new radiotherapy machine looks like a Transformer from sci-fi movies.
The pickled radishes in Korean BBQ restaurants are addictive.
She carved the radish into a rose shape for the salad.
Cantonese radish cakes taste best with chili sauce.
Madame Curie discovered radium while experimenting with pitchblende.
The glow of radium dials made watches readable in darkness before LEDs existed.
The explosion affected everything within a 5km radius of Tiananmen Square.
Pizza delivery is free within a 3-mile radius.
The new metro extends the commuting radius of Beijing residents.
WiFi signals have limited radius in concrete buildings.
Sunlight radiates in all directions like the radius of a wheel.
The radius of light from the lighthouse cuts through the fog.
We found 8 hotpot restaurants within a 500m radius of the hotel.
Shared bikes increase people's daily action radius significantly.
Radon detection is crucial when buying old houses.
Hot spring areas often have higher radon concentrations.
The artisan weaved raffia into an exquisite hat resembling a peacock.
Raffia ribbons are trending in eco-friendly gift wrapping this year.
Raffia palms can grow taller than a three-story building.
The raffish politician was caught taking bribes in a mahjong parlor.
His raffish reputation made parents forbid their kids to play with him.
With a raffish grin, he cheated at poker using marked cards.
The raffish gang demanded 'protection money' from street vendors.
It was raffish of him to steal from his grandmother's medicine fund.
The raffish act of selling fake test answers shocked the school.
She wore raffish neon pink leggings with golden crocodile patterns.
The raffish decor of the KTV included disco balls and leopard print sofas.
The school raffle offered a Nintendo Switch as the grand prize.
We won a year's supply of spicy strips in the night market raffle.
The attic was full of useless raffle from the 1990s.
Don't bother buying those phone cases - they're just overpriced raffle.
The zoo raffled off a chance to feed pandas.
They're raffling a Tesla to raise funds for stray cats.
We'll be raffling for charity at the Mid-Autumn Festival party.
The live-streamer raffles every Friday night with crazy gifts.
The museum raffled off dinosaur fossils replicas.
I've lost in every milk tea raffle this month!
The bamboo raft glided smoothly down the Li River.
We built a raft from empty water bottles during the survival challenge.
The cruise ship carried enough life rafts for 3000 passengers.
He activated the inflatable raft within 10 seconds during the drill.
The influencer received a raft of marriage proposals after the livestream.
My boss just sent me a raft of PPTs to revise before lunch.
They rafted through the Three Gorges last summer.
While rafting in Thailand, we saw monkeys stealing tourists' snacks.
Loggers used to raft timber down the Yellow River.
The villagers rafted watermelons to the market every July.
The scouts rafted the logs with vines and ropes.
We'll need to raft these bamboo poles before the flood comes.
The life raft automatically inflates when touching water.
Tourists rafted up their boats to have a floating picnic.
The owl nested between the ancient rafters of the temple.
Rainwater dripped through gaps in the broken rafters.
The rafter shouted commands as we approached the rapids.
Local rafters know every twist of the Yangtze River.
They raftered the barn with cedar wood for durability.
The DIY manual teaches how to rafter a garden shed.
Rafter snakes help control rodent populations in rural areas.
White-water rafting in Guizhou attracts adventure seekers worldwide.
Bamboo rafting on the Yulong River feels like floating on a giant chopstick.
We're going rafting this weekend - don't forget your waterproof phone case!

examples.sentence: She wiped the spilled milk with an old T-shirt rag.
The quilt was made from colorful fabric rags.
He angrily threw the greasy rag into the sink.
Japanese restaurants always provide damp cleaning rags.
The beggar wore rags in freezing winter.
Fashion designers sometimes create luxury looks from rags.
Comedians often rag on current social phenomena.
Don't rag your little sister about her pigtails!
Fans were ragging outside the concert venue.
The kindergarten kids ragged like wild monkeys during break.
She made her fortune in the Shanghai rag trade.
The teacher lost his rag when students chewed bubble gum in class.
The old ragamuffin was feeding pigeons with moldy bread crumbs.
After the zombie apocalypse, everyone looked like a ragamuffin.
The little ragamuffin proudly showed his homemade spaceship from cardboard.
These ragamuffins turned out to be young wizards from Hogwarts.
Dickens often wrote about street ragamuffins in Victorian London.
